summary: Improper payments—those that should not have been made or were made in the incorrect amount—have consistently been a government-wide issue. Since fiscal year 2003, federal agencies reported about $2.7 trillion in total improper payments. In FY 2023 alone, federal agencies made $236 billion in improper payments, a decrease of about $11 billion from the prior fiscal year. This Q&A report shows that this estimate doesn't...
title: Improper Payments: Information on Agencies' Fiscal Year 2023 Estimates
